summary: This is an email chain from July 2021 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) for the Southern District of New York and a contact named Tracy, discussing the search for a records custodian for FedEx records. The records pertain to a subpoena sent by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to FedEx in February 2008 regarding Jeffrey Epstein. The email includes an attachment of a FedEx invoice from 2002.

persons.name: Tracy
persons.context: Addressed in an email by an AUSA seeking assistance in locating a records custodian for FedEx records related to a 2008 subpoena concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey E Epstein
persons.context: The FedEx records being sought are regarding him, as indicated by the attached invoice filename and the context of the subpoena.

connections.description: Tracy is being contacted to help locate records custodians for FedEx documents that are part of an investigation into Epstein.

events.title: SDFL Subpoena to FedEx
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida sent a subpoena to FedEx.

events.title: Email Request for Records Custodian
events.description: An AUSA from SDNY emails Tracy seeking assistance in finding a records custodian for the FedEx records related to the 2008 subpoena.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida issued a subpoena to FedEx in February 2008 regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
In July 2021, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively seeking a records custodian for those FedEx records.
An attached document is a FedEx invoice dated October 14, 2002, related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative activity into Epstein's affairs years after his death.
